title: Making Fitness Fit: How to Build Exercise into Your Day
description: Making Fitness Fit: How to Build Exercise into Your Day Practical tips for getting fit done – even when it feels like you just don’t have the time.

components.copy: Making Fitness Fit: How to Build Exercise into Your Day

text: Practical tips for getting fit done – even when it feels like you just don’t have the time.

When it comes to exercise, most folks fall into the trap of believing an all-or-nothing approach is the only way to achieve their health and fitness goals — but this couldn’t be further from the truth.

Whether you’re a fitness newbie or just trying to get your mojo back, don’t feel like you need to spend hours in the gym each day. A few short bursts of exercise, some clever time management, and a little bit of extra movement throughout the day can make all the difference — especially when you have the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 5G on your side.

The lighter, thinner, and durable device boasts features like Flex mode, Multi Window, and Dual Preview functions for better productivity, plus a hidden camera under the screen to give an uninterrupted view — all made to revolutionise how you work and play.
Here’s how to make fitness fit into your life — so you can reap all the feel-good benefits that come along with it.

Who doesn’t love a snack? Instead of carving out a chunk of your day for a workout, break it down into more manageable, bite-sized chunks. That could mean 15, 10, or even five-minute bursts between meetings, or while you’re waiting for your coffee to brew. Here are some ideas for you to ‘snack’ on:
• 3 sets of 10-15 squats
• 3 sets of 10-12 push-ups (on your knees is just fine!)
• 3 sets of walking lunges, 10 reps on each leg
• 5 1-minute planks, with a 30-sec rest in between
• 5 1-minute rounds of skipping/jumping jacks, with a 30-sec rest in between
If you’re an office worker, a brisk walk about the office, or a walk to the top floor and back down (via the stairs, of course) is just the ticket.

Research by BUPA <sup>1</sup>  suggests that less than a third of UK workers take a proper lunch break each day. Not only does this make for a rather crusty keyboard — it can also be detrimental to your health and productivity.

If too much work is standing in your way, consider this: another study by Tork <sup>2</sup>  found that workers who took a lunch break reported being more efficient and productive. So, time away from your desk may actually help you get more done.

If you can take 30 minutes to an hour, spend some of it getting some additional movement in — whether that means a walk to a nearby park or a quick workout with your go-to fitness app. It’s also a great time to work in a larger ‘exercise snack’ — you could fit in three of the options above in 15 minutes.

1Bupa Research. 2015. Take a break https://www.bupa.com/newsroom/news/take-a-break

2Tork. Essity Professional Hygiene. Take Back the Lunch Break survey findings https://cdntorkprod.blob.core.windows.net/docs-c5/763/185763/original/tork-takes-back-survey.pdf

You’d never skip a meeting with a colleague or a catch-up with a friend. Why not treat your workouts the same way? Use your calendar app to plan your workouts for the week ahead and treat them like a non-negotiable appointment with yourself.

If exercise snacking is your preferred MO, make sure you schedule those in too. Manage to slot in ten minutes three times a day? That’s a half-hour workout, and enough for you to hit the global recommended daily activity guidelines<sup>3</sup> — well done!
If you need to keep one eye on your email or other notifications while working out, the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 5G is your one-stop shop.

Multi-window mode makes it easier to multitask when you’re squeezing in a quick session with your favourite workout app — you can have both your exercise and work apps on-screen simultaneously. You’ll see new emails coming in real-time while you exercise. You can even adjust the transparency of your email app, so it’s not too distracting mid-workout.

Hot and sweaty aren’t your only options when it comes to fitness. In fact, if you’re strapped for time, combining exercise with another health and wellness essential — mindfulness — could be a gamechanger.
3BMJ World Health Organisation guidelines on physical activity. 2020. https://bjsm.bmj.com/content/54/24/1451

When it comes to de-stressing and building strength and flexibility, yoga is one form of exercise that just can’t be beat. In fact, a study<sup>4</sup>  has shown that people who practise yoga regularly have lower levels of the stress hormone, cortisol, while another<sup>5</sup>  showed that yoga could improve mood and lower anxiety levels more effectively than walking.

Another multitasking move: catch-ups with friends are the perfect opportunity for a little extra activity. Meet in the park for a walk or brave a new fitness class at your local studio together. That post-workout smoothie will taste so much sweeter with a mate.

4PMC. Association of Yoga practice. 2016. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4784068/

5PMC. Effects of Yoga versus Walking on the Mood, Anxiety and Brain GABA Levels. 2010. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3111147/

If leaving the home is not an option, a video call works too! Call up a mate, choose a session from your go-to app, and hit start at the same time. The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold3 5G’s multi-window mode shines here too. You can keep an eye on your buddy (and them you — thanks to that hidden camera under the screen to give an uninterrupted view) while you get your workout on. With a 7.6" Dynamic AMOLED 2X display, there’s plenty of room for a group sweat sesh too — the more the merrier, right?
By Kirsti Buick
Kirsti is a freelance health and fitness journalist and qualified personal trainer
